snippet: Such a move would fall well short of declaring independence but would most likely rile both the government and the main Arab-led opposition group.
abstract: Syrian Kurdish representatives say they are working on plan to formalize semiautonomous zone established in northern Syria, precursor to creating model upon which decentralized form of government in country can be based; plan is latest development in debate both about Kurds' place in region and future of Syrian state.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Karam Shoumali and Ceylan Yeginsu from Istanbul, and Maher Samaan from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Such a move would fall well short of declaring independence but would most likely rile both the government and the main Arab-led opposition group.

headline.main: Syrian Kurds Hope to Establish a Federal Region in Country’s North
headline.print_headline: Syrian Kurds Look to Create Federal Region in Nation’s North
